comments.text:
This is the OS X version of bug 607224

Currently 10 traditional menu items in Firefox are redundant with controls in
the main window, and these menu items are currently only present so that they
can be accessed by users who rely on a screen reader or keyboard access.

The 12 menu commands are:

File > Open Location
File > Close Window
File > Close Tab
Edit > Find Again
View > Stop
View > Reload
History > Back
History > Forward
History > Home
Tools > Web Search

To streamline the Firefox interface, we would like to only display these 10
menu commands if the user is actively using a screen reader, or if they invoked
the traditional menu using the alt key.
comments.creator: faaborg@gmail.com

comments.text:
Looks like we're not currently supporting accessibility on OS X in any case, Surkov (CCed) told me you have to compile a special version with:

ac_add_options --enable-accessibility

…in that case, I think we should proceed with the menu cleanup on Mac and add in support for it in the --enable-accessibility if we can later. But I'll let the accessibility people weigh in first. :)

> Alternatively, if there's another way to expose this to screen readers, but not

Often when you have to have two different interfaces depending whether the user use screen reader or not means there's something wrong with interface design.

If interface is operable well by keyboard then usually it means you don't need a special interface for screen reader support.

(In reply to comment #5)
> Often when you have to have two different interfaces depending whether the user

That rule is a little bit too broad to be applicable here, IMO.

> If interface is operable well by keyboard then usually it means you don't need
> a special interface for screen reader support.

The interface is 100% usable by keyboard, but the discoverability of shortcuts for things like back/forward, stop, close tab, etc. *might* be worse if we remove them from the menus. I don't really know, which is why this bug asks. :)

Discoverability is important for screen reader users, if these items are accessible by shortcuts that should be known for screen reader user then that's what we'd need to fix (well, it doesn't really matter until we're accessible on mac). But that is applicable to users who is a keyboard geek.

The initial proposition of the bug to show menuitems on alt key sounds reasonable to me. If I get right alt key is used by screen reader users as well (it's worth to check that with Marco). And on another hand keyboard users should be happy as well.
